channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dayone's Blog

item.title: Git Command Cheat Sheet
item.description: Git Command Cheat Sheet 1. Basics check out your git version git --version change username and email git config --global user.name "A-one_Day1" git config --global user.email "dwdsuh@gmail.com" help git help config git config --help config is just an example. you can type clone, merge etc initialize git git init remove git rm -rf .git check out the state git status make some file not tracked by git(not to push to repository) touch .

item.title: Searhing_strategy
item.description: Greedy Search an algorithmic paradigm that follows the problem solving heuristic of making the locally optimal choice at each stage. traveling salesman problem: At each step of the journey, visit the nearest unvisited city. Does Not ensure the global optimum, but returns locally optimal solutions. Beam Search beam width: the number of candidates that we are going to examine at each step. If the beam width ==1, it is greedy search.

item.title: tf.estimator/텐서플로우 에스티메이터 활용하기
item.description: Implementing tf.estimator/ 텐서플로우 에스티메이터 활용하기 출처(source): 텐서플로와 머신러닝으로 시작하는 자연어처리. 전창욱 외 2명. 위키북스. 2019 1. Overview What is Estimator? High level API that helps developers train, evalutate, predict and export the models. 2 major factors model_function def model_fn(features, labels, mode, params, config): # construct your model here return tf.estimator.EstimatorSpec(...) features: Input data. The data structure of those should be either tf.Tensor or dictionary

item.title: Linux Command Cheat Sheet/리눅스 명령어 정리
item.description: Linux Command Cheat Sheet/ 리눅스 명령어 정리 This blog post is a summary of Mr. Schafer’s youtube video Mac Terminal Cheat Sheet Ctrl+a: 맨 앞으로 Ctrl+e: 맨 뒤로 Opt+마우스 클릭: 커서 이동 Ctrl+u: 커서 앞의 내용 모두 삭제 Ctrl+k: 커서 뒤의 내용 모두 삭제 drag and drop folder: 디렉토리 경로 완성 find commend in linux find . –> 모든 파일 탐색 find . -type d –> 디렉토리 탐색.

item.title: Preprocessing
item.description: [Preprocessing]: How to Randomly Sample from a File of Tremendous Size. Dealing with Big Data, I usually have to handle data “bigger” than 10GB. Last week, I wanted to sample 100K sentences from the file of 50M-ish sentences. At first, I naively wrote a code to open the file and select samples using indexing samples with numpy.random. Unfortunately, the code was starting to deprive me of my lifetime. I cannot help interrupting the code and searching for the faster method.

Git Command Cheat Sheet 1. Basics check out your git version git --version change username and email git config --global user.name "A-one_Day1" git config --global user.email "dwdsuh@gmail.com" help git help config git config --help config is just an example. you can type clone, merge etc initialize git git init remove git rm -rf .git check out the state git status make some file not tracked by git(not to push to repository) touch .
